body.p:
Harlan County Kentucky
Dec 18th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette Govenor

Sir -- your Petitioner Levi Hoskins most respectfully states to your excellency that at the September Term of the Knox circuit court 1865 he was fined in the Sum of Twenty Dollars for retailing spirits Your Petitioner States that he was fined for selling when there was no courts being held by cause of the rebellion & that he did not wish to violate any law but happened to have Some whisky & let Some go by the Smalls not thinking it was wrong -- your Petitioner further states that he is a cripple & is very Poor having a large family to Support and that it would be very hard upon himself & family to have the said fine to pay -- your Petitioner therefore most respectfully but earnestly askes your Excellency to remit the said fine

Very Respectfully
Levi Hoskins
Cumberland Ford Ky
We the undersigned citizens most respectfully ask your excellency to remit the said fine
